title: Italian 70s script
author: sandisirocco

comments.content: It’s called Pollux Script, by URW, but I can’t find a commercial source for it.

It also looks very close if not exact to **Palace Script (Semibold)** by Monotype:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/palace-script/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317192416/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/palace-script/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/palace-script/")  
(which is commercially available)

I compared the two fonts and found a few differences, such as the upper swash on \_R\_, but the main difference was that Palace Script connected smoothly, while Pollux Script -- at least the old copies of two versions I had on file -- connected with a gap.  
Palace Script dates from 1923 as a Stephenson Blake/Monotype font.  
Similar fonts from that era: Embassy Script (Caslon 1924), Marina, Imperial, Society Script (all Stephenson Blake). [Source: Jaspert's Type Encyclopaedia]  
Don
